form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Moreno introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose a daily tax on members of Congress during a lapse in appropriations.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Holding Up Taxpayers, Deny wages On Washington’s Negligence Act or the SHUTDOWN Act.

section.header: Imposition of daily tax on members of congress during lapse in appropriations

subsection.text: Subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new part:

part.header: Tax relating to lapses in appropriations

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 59B. Daily tax on members of Congress during lapses in appropriations.

section.header: Daily tax on members of Congress during lapses in appropriations

subsection.text: In addition to any other tax, in the case of any period in which there is a lapse in appropriations, there is hereby imposed on each individual serving as a Member of Congress on any day during such period a tax equal to the applicable percentage of the applicable wages of such individual.
For purposes of this section, the term applicable percentage means, with respect to any individual, the ratio (expressed as a percentage) of—

paragraph.text: the number of days during the period described in subsection (a)—

subparagraph.text: which occurred during the taxable year, and
during which such individual served as a Member of Congress, and

paragraph.text: the number of days during the taxable year on which such individual served as a Member of Congress.

subsection.text: For purpose of this section, the term applicable wages means wages (as defined in section 3401(a)) received for services performed as a Member of Congress.

paragraph.text: The term Member of Congress means a member of the Senate or the House of Representatives, a Delegate to the House of Representatives, and the Resident Commissioner from Puerto Rico.

The term lapse in appropriations means any period during which any regular appropriation bill or continuing resolution for a fiscal year is not in effect with respect to any Federal agency or department.

subsection.text: The table of parts for subchapter A of chapter 1 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: PART VIII—Tax relating to lapses in appropriations

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
